title: Family Systems
subtitle: Understanding the patterns you inherited
description: Your family shaped you in ways you're still discovering. This course helps you understand family systems dynamics, recognize inherited patterns, navigate difficult family relationships, and break cycles you don't want to continue.

requirements: Professional support for severe family trauma

questions.question: What does 'family systems' perspective emphasize?
options: The family operates as an interconnected system where each member affects the others

questions.question: What are common family roles?
options: Hero, scapegoat, lost child, mascot, enabler, and others

questions.question: What is 'intergenerational transmission'?
options: How trauma, patterns, and beliefs pass from one generation to the next

questions.question: What is 'triangulation' in family systems?
options: When two people involve a third to manage tension between them

questions.question: How can adults change their role in the family system?
options: Through differentiation, boundaries, and responding differently to old patterns
By getting family to change first

questions.question: What does 'breaking a cycle' require?
options: Awareness of the pattern, understanding its function, and consistent different choices
